## useInterferer() function

returns new wire and interfering setValue of returned wire

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function useInterferer<Value>(
  wire: Wire<Value>,
  interferer: Interferer<Value>,
): Wire<Value>;
```

## Parameters

| Parameter  | Type                                 | Description         |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------ | ------------------- |
| wire       | <code>Wire&lt;Value&gt;</code>       | up-link wire        |
| interferer | <code>Interferer&lt;Value&gt;</code> | interferer function |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Wire<Value>`

new interfered wire

## Remarks

the interferer function gets the next value and previous value and returns a value. the returned value be set on up-link wire. if interferer function returns `undefined` or the same value as previous value, up-link wire value will not change.

## Example

```tsx
const valueWire = useInterferer(
  props.valueWire,
  useCallback(
    (nextValue, preValue) =>
      props.submittingWire.getValue() ? preValue : nextValue,
    [props.submittingWire],
  ),
);
```
